fields.description:
A few days ago, we have upgraded our Subversion server to:
- Subversion 1.6.1 (for Apache 2.2)
- Apache HTTPD 2.2.11
- FishEye/Crucible 1.6.6

Using cvs2svn version 2.2.0, we have converted a few CVS modules to Subversion repositories after we upgraded the Subversion server.
When we add these new Subversion repositories to FishEye and test the connection, we get the following error:

{noformat}
Error testing connection.
com.cenqua.fisheye.config.ConfigException - Unable to get repository information: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: Unable to open an ra_local session to URL svn: Unable to open repository 'file:///D:/SvnData/Repositories/Departments' svn: Expected FS format between '1' and '3'; found format '4'
com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException - org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: Unable to open an ra_local session to URL svn: Unable to open repository 'file:///D:/SvnData/Repositories/Departments' svn: Expected FS format between '1' and '3'; found format '4'
org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException - svn: Unable to open an ra_local session to URL svn: Unable to open repository 'file:///D:/SvnData/Repositories/Departments' svn: Expected FS format between '1' and '3'; found format '4'
org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNException - svn: Unable to open an ra_local session to URL svn: Unable to open repository 'file:///D:/SvnData/Repositories/Departments' svn: Expected FS format between '1' and '3'; found format '4'

Connection failure.
{noformat}

It looks like the new repositories are created with "FS format 4", which the SVN client of FishEye does not understand.
fields.summary: Unable to open connection to Subverion version 1.6.1

fields.description:
Hello,

This is Luke from Korean partner, Goldpitcher.

One of our cusomer requested that Fisheye must have additional option of repository access conflguration for SVN.

SVN has own repository access permission. So If Fisheye uses this one, it will be more easy to set access permission.

We also this is better when it comes to SVN.

BR,
Luke
fields.summary: Additional Option for FishEye to set Access permission with SVN repository permission itself.
Make scale/chart nicer on code-metrics-report

fields.description:
We recently migrated from Bugzilla to Jira and have set up Jira Fisheye plugin. We have noticed the following:

1. When an issue is closed in Jira, Fisheye DELETES the perforce job. This is not desired. What happens when the issue is reopened? Does Fisheye create a new job?
2. For manually created p4 jobs, any status change in the corresponding Jira job deletes the perforce job. Why??

These two issues are currently blocking our Fisheye deployment.
fields.summary: Fisheye deletes jobs from P4 jobs database

fields.description:
If you have "Global anonymous access off", then browser will prompt you for a user login (e.g. user/pass) even if you are accessing [http://<host>/admin-api] (which should only require the admin password). After you have logged in as a normal user, the browser will prompt another login dialog for Admin Remote API access.
This makes things difficult for users who are trying to access the admin-api via scripts. 

However, if you have "Global anonymous access on" you should be able to see the login dialog for Admin Remote API access directly e.g see http://fisheye4.atlassian.com/admin-api/
fields.summary: Problem accessing Admin Remote API if the global anonymous access is off

fields.description:
Hi,

The 'Permission Scheme' list in the Edit Project screen is unsorted.

Cheers,
Rene
fields.summary: Permission Scheme list should be sorted

fields.description:
Hi,

In Repository Default I've set 'Allow anonymous access' to NO.
When I add a new repository and then edit the Permissions (to limit access to a group), the 'Allow anonymous access' setting is flipped to YES.
If you're not aware of this you end up granting anonymous access to repos by mistake.

Once a repo is created, editing the Permissions leaves the setting intact.

Cheers,
Rene
fields.summary: Repository default 'Allow anonymous access' not respected

fields.description:
Hi,

Assume I have a Perforce project that's composed of multiple paths:
- //depot-app/projectA/main/...
- //depot-gen/engineX/branch/rel123/...

The FishEye repository is then configured as:
- Path = //
- Allow Includes
-- depot-app/projectA/main/
-- depot-gen/engineX/branch/rel123/

The initial scan (or a re-index) is walking through each and every perforce changelist, making this a very time-consuming action.
Why doesn't it limit scanning the submits to the specified Includes only?

In our case, instead of a 1 hour slurp it easily takes up to a day.

Dunno if this  also applies to CVS/SVN.

Cheers,
Rene
fields.summary: Perforce projects with multiple paths are scanned extremely inefficient

fields.description:
Hi,

Adding a new group and populating it is a pain.
I have to visit each and every user and add it to the group.
It would be way more intuitive and efficient if a userlist would be shown from which users could be picked to join or leave the group.

Cheers,
Rene
fields.summary: Improve group membership management

fields.description:
Hi,

Curently the user browser only allows searching on e-mail address.
Please add the ability to also search on (part of) accountname and fullname.
Case insensitive of course ;)

Cheers,
Rene
fields.summary: Allow searching on accountname and fullname in user browser

fields.description:
Hi,

The user browser uses a case-sensitive search on the e-mail address.
As e-mail addresses are not case-sensitive by itself, we have a mix of lower-, and proper-cased addresses.
The result is that I can't just search on the name as that doesn't necessarily match, I have to leave of the 1st character of the name.
E.g. Charlie Atlas can have e-mail addresses charlie.atlas@ or Charlie.Atlas@, so I have to either search on 'charlie' and 'Charlie', or 'harlie".
I suggest you always do a case-insensitive search.

Cheers,
Rene
fields.summary: User browser should not use case-sensitive search on e-mail address

fields.description:
If you accidentally include the trailing spaces on a revision number when using the 'Show Arbitrary Diff' function in FishEye, it throws a 404.

For example, if I accidentally copied the trailing space on revision number 75461 on this file:
https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/browse/jira/jira-docs/trunk/web/src/documentation/content/xdocs/external-refs.xml

and then pasted the revision number plus trailing space into the one of the two fields for 'Show Arbitrary Diff', then a 404 will result. If I remove the trailing space, then it works.

This took me a while to figure out and could be annoying for customers.
fields.summary: FishEye throws a 404 if the revision number includes trailing spaces doing a diff

* -Expanding details of a JIRA issue in the activity stream () sometimes causes the summary line to appear in place of "details >>" instead of the details.  It is later replaced by the actual details.- (http://img.skitch.com/20090406-q17aid9kjme9jcmw2bm6hqe8y5.png)
* -JIRA tab messed up- (http://skitch.com/conor/bksax/activity-fe)
* Poor grammar in JIRA activity stream: "xxxx changed the status to Ready For Testing of PLF-279 (xxxxx: xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxx
* -Clicking "Expand" on the JIRA activity stream tab causes all instances of "details" to be replaced with the summary line, rather than details. Details never appear- (http://img.skitch.com/20090406-qwq4m7d2gg84bbnuijbdiyx4jm.png)
* -JIRA activity details are presented in a mishmash of typefaces:- (http://img.skitch.com/20090406-mjdgpnaahjgufsjhxy71n57b47.png)
fields.summary: Fix JIRA Activity Streams

fields.description:
Currently user filter is the only way we can restrict users that can have access to fisheye. We should also include a group filter to allow only users that match the user filter and belong to groups defined by the group filter to be able to access fisheye. 

In addition if we sync, then it should only sync users that match the user filter and belong to groups defined by the group filter.
fields.summary: For POSIX type LDAP schemas allow a group filter to limit which users have access to (are allowed) to log into fisheye

fields.description:
one of the commiters seems to be the "" empty string, and appears in all the dropdowns. this is a bug, there should never be a "" commiter

We could given blank/absent commiters the name no_author (prefered solution), or handle the construction of urls "to" blank committers.

fields.description:
We should consider looking at changing FishEye to process tag deletions by removing tags and not creating the subtree entries.

h3.Workaround
Exclude the deleted path and restart FishEye/Crucible:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Include+Exclude+paths
fields.summary: Fisheye should consider changing how it deals with tag deletion

fields.description:
The following error always occurs in the log when this happens:
{code}
2009-03-31 10:57:43,867 ERROR [btpool0-71] org.mortbay.log sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor991-invoke - EXCEPTION
  java.lang.NumberFormatException: uC
  at org.mortbay.util.TypeUtil.parseInt(TypeUtil.java:345)
  at org.mortbay.util.URIUtil.decodePath(URIUtil.java:197)
{code}

Please refer to [http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY-688]

h6. Solution

Upgrade to FishEye 2.0 for a fix. If you are unable to upgrade, you can replace your jetty 6.1.10 jars with the 6.1.15 which contains the fix. To do this, 

1) Shutdown your server 
2) Copy your {{FISHEYE_INST/lib/jetty-6.1.10.jar}}, {{FISHEYE_INST/lib/jetty-ajp-6.1.10.jar}}, {{FISHEYE_INST/lib/jetty-util-6.1.10.jar}} files to another location and delete these three jars from your {{FISHEYE_INST/lib/}} directory 
3) Download jetty-6.1.15.zip from [http://dist.codehaus.org/jetty/jetty-6.1.15/] and extract it in some temp directory 
4) Copy the {{jetty-6.1.15/lib/jetty-6.1.15.jar}}, {{jetty-6.1.15/lib/jetty-util-6.1.15.jar}}, {{jetty-6.1.15/lib/ext/jetty-ajp-6.1.15.jar}} files into the {{FISHEYE_INST/lib}} directory 
5) Restart fisheye
fields.summary: Use Session Expires due to Jetty bug (JETTY-688)

fields.description: The case sensitive flag exists in excludes option but not for includes option. See the screen shots.
fields.summary: Add case sensitive flag to the includes

fields.description:
Fisheye is a crawler, and so like any good crawler citizen, should:
 a) advertise a proper User-Agent string
 b) read and obey what's in robots.txt, particularly the Crawl-delay: parameter, so that administrators can stop rogue Fisheyes from killing the system.
fields.summary: Fisheye should support robots.txt

fields.description: I'd like to be able to direct people to a page with just the source files in Fisheye (Sub directories), not showing the recent changelog, line history and even contraints.  For example, http://www.limewire.org/fisheye/browse/limecvs gives too much info for people who just want a quick look of the code from their web browser.
fields.summary: Page listing only source files to browse
